name: RESOURCE DIRECTORY
description: Disclaimer The Bexar County Behavioral Health Resource Directory provides a list of behavioral health resources and services that may be helpful to the public. Bexar County strives to ensure this information is accurate at the time of publication. However, Bexar County makes no representa- tions, guaranties, or warranties as to the accuracy, completeness, relia- bility, or suitability of the information or services contained herein. Bexar County shall under no circumstance be responsible for any er- rors or omissions which may occur in this Directory, be liable for any actions taken or damages as a result of reliance upon any information contained in this Directory, or be liable for the actions of any entity listed in the Directory. Under no circumstance should the inclusion of an entity in the Directory be construed as an endorsement or recom- mendation of the entity by Bexar County. Service Options To help assist in finding services that meet your needs, agencies were asked to indicate specific service options they have available. The fol- Telehealth Certain services are available over the phone Sliding Scale Service payments can be adjusted based on your income. Unfunded/No Cost Certain services may be eligible for the indicated service or payment method Our Team Gilbert R. Gonzales Director Leticia Dominguez, LCSW Manager Melissa D. Lucio, LCDC Substance Use Program Coordinator Victoria Gomez School-Based Mental Wellness Program Manager Stacey Eure Senior Program Analyst Contact Us 4

name: CENTER FOR HEALTHCARE SERVICES
description: chcsbc.org The Center for Health Care Services provides integrated care to im- prove the lives of children and adults with mental health conditions, substance use challenges, and intellectual or developmental disabili- ties. The Center for Health Care Services offers a sliding fee scale and accepts all patients regardless of inability to pay. Adult Behavioral Health Services Comprehensive mental health services to support each person’s goals for recovery, including: psychiatric evaluation and treatment, medication management, wellness counseling and education, indi- vidual and group therapy, psychiatric care, psychosocial rehabilita- tion, and case management offered at a variety of locations. Outpatient Mental Health Services Intensive Mental Health Services Long-Term Care Services Children’s Behavioral Health Services Being mentally healthy in childhood means reaching developmental and emotional milestones, learning healthy social skills, and how to cope when problems arise. When there is a concern that a child might not be meeting these milestones, The Center offers an array of services that can help. Outpatient Mental Health Services (ages 3-17) Juvenile Justice Programs (ages 10-17) Intensive Mental Health Services Substance Use Services The CHCS Restoration Center and transformational services help people break the cycle of addiction and regain sobriety through safe, meaningful programs that reduce harms associated with substance use, promote total recovery for people with co-occurring mental health and substance use disorders, and provide better care coordi- nation. Outpatient Treatment Residential Treatment Intellectual and Developmental Disability Services (IDD) People living with IDD deserve to live life to its fullest, and may re- quire long-term services and supports indefinitely. By promoting dignity and choice for adults with IDD, the CHCS Long-Term Care Services help improve the quality of life for consumers and their loved ones through programs designed for inclusivity, accessibil- ity, and independence. Residential Services Day Habilitation Employment Connections Other Help Specialties Primary Care Peer Services Homelessness Veteran Services Law Enforcement Supportive Housing Supported Employment Court-ordered Treatment High Utilizers of ERs & Inpatient Treatment Outreach, Linkage, and Support

name: NAMI - SAN ANTONIO
description: National Alliance on Mental Illness NAMI is the National Alliance on Mental Illness, the nation’s largest grassroots mental health or- ganization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental ill- ness. Support Groups Free, confidential peer support groups discuss- ing mental health to gain insight from the chal- lenges and successes of others facing similar ex- periences. Separate groups are available for adults (18+) with mental health conditions and their families. NAMI on Campus Student-led clubs that support fellow stu- dents raise mental health awareness, educate the campus community and promote services and supports. Pathways to Hope Conference Free, community-wide conference focused on reducing stigma, improving mental health sup- port, providing education and resources Education Free educational programs to discuss mental health experiences, effective tools for recovery, common support needs for individuals experi- encing mental illness and their families. Stigma Reduction Free presentations can be scheduled that in- form and educate viewers of the warning signs and misconceptions of mental health condi- tions. Ending the Silence In Our Own Voice NAMIWalk namiwalks.org Annual mental health awareness 5k fundraiser encouraging Mental Health for All.
